raw_response.summary_short: Historic Denver house museum focused on Margaret “Molly” Brown—best known as a Titanic survivor—with ticketed admission, events, and group experiences.
raw_response.summary_long: Historic Denver’s Molly Brown House Museum interprets the life and legacy of Margaret “Molly” Brown, widely known as a survivor of the Titanic. The museum offers ticketed admission, visitor planning information, public events, and bookable private group experiences, positioning the site as a focused biographical and local-history museum experience in Denver.

collection_highlights.title: Margaret “Molly” Brown interpretation (Titanic survivor and broader life story)
collection_highlights.description: The museum centers on Molly Brown, emphasizing that she was “so much more” than her Titanic survival story.

visitor_tips: Check the museum calendar for closure dates before visiting (closures are posted on the site).
Purchase tickets in advance via the museum’s online admission/ticketing links.
Use the “Plan Your Visit” guest information page to prepare logistics.
Consider booking a private group experience if visiting with an organized group.
Look at the events listing to align your visit with programs or special activities.
raw_response.best_for: Visitors interested in Titanic history, Denver history, and a focused biographical house-museum experience.
